text:
*[Bug 18887] Wish: support for concatenated gzip archives in gzcon*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18887>

--- Comment #6 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
(In reply to Brian Ripley from comment #5)
I am not able to match the line number reported by the compiler, but from
reading the code I think the warning was in 88409, there we had "char method"
but "int gzcon_byte()".

But 88566 was I think already fine on this line - there we had, and now have
again, "int method" and "int gzcon_byte()". I used "int" to match gzio.h as
closely as possible in types and code structure.

The bug was likely sign-extension, casting/converting (signed) char 0xFF to
int, which turns 0xFF to EOF (R_EOF).

elements.text: [Bug 18887] Wish: support for concatenated gzip archives in gzcon

) ---
(In reply to Brian Ripley from comment #5)
I am not able to match the line number reported by the compiler, but from
reading the code I think the warning was in 88409, there we had "char method"
but "int gzcon_byte()".

But 88566 was I think already fine on this line - there we had, and now have
again, "int method" and "int gzcon_byte()". I used "int" to match gzio.h as
closely as possible in types and code structure.

The bug was likely sign-extension, casting/converting (signed) char 0xFF to
int, which turns 0xFF to EOF (R_EOF).

text:
*[Bug 18926] Improve documentation and error messages for rep()*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18926>

--- Comment #10 from Siddhesh Akole (<mailto:siddheshakole@gmail.com|siddheshakole@gmail.com>) ---
if we take an Example: 
if each == 0 
rep(1:3,times = 1:3 , each = 0)  

it is trigger's Error 4 :- Invalid Times argument 

which make's non sense because there is a Problem with each 

So I am suggesting a new patch for updated Error call's for :- 

#if each == 0 
#if each == 1 
#if each > 1

elements.text: [Bug 18926] Improve documentation and error messages for rep()

) ---
if we take an Example: 
if each == 0 
rep(1:3,times = 1:3 , each = 0)  

it is trigger's Error 4 :- Invalid Times argument 

which make's non sense because there is a Problem with each 

So I am suggesting a new patch for updated Error call's for :- 

#if each == 0 
#if each == 1 
#if each > 1

text:
*[Bug 17733] Error with QuartzBitmap_Output to /dev/null*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=17733>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
                 CC|                            |tomas.kalibera@gmail.com
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED

--- Comment #4 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Yes, CGImageDestinationCreateWithURL() fails with file:///dev/null. I didn't
find that documented in the Apple documentation anywhere. 

I've added a work-around on the R side: no output is created, no error is
reported. So one can now do

png(nullfile())
plot(1:100)
dev.off()

also on macOS without getting an error.

also on macOS without getting an error.

*[Bug 14878] Use Endash in Negative Sign in Numbers instead of Hyphen*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=14878>

Eric Lindblad (<mailto:lindblad@gmx.com|lindblad@gmx.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |lindblad@gmx.com

--- Comment #4 from Eric Lindblad (<mailto:lindblad@gmx.com|lindblad@gmx.com>) ---
The comments seem to be about two different characters.

> an endash

U+2013 En Dash

> negative into a \U2212

U+2212 MINUS SIGN
